data.title: St James Church School
data.meta_description: School Ratings for St James Church School, Cranmer Road, Taunton, Somerset, TA1 1XU. This school was rated Good by Ofsted in January 2019. For it's latest set of KS2 results 22 percent of students met the expected standard in Reading, Writing and Maths and 5 percent of students met the higher standard.
data.text:
Type Primary Age Range 3-11 Religion Church of England Address Cranmer Road

Taunton

Somerset

TA1 1XU Phone 01823272553 Reference Number 139324

Description

beta

St James' Church School is a primary institution located in Teddington, Middlesex (postcode TA1 1XU), England. The school is an academy within the Church of England's diocese of Oxford and is a designated member of the Reading Boy's School Trust. As of 2024, the school offers a classical Christian education, integrating Scripture and rich linguistic, literary, and mathematical content into its curriculum.

Key facts about St James' Church School include:

A classical Christian school focusing on the arts, humanities, and the natural sciences

Opened in 1926 and attended by children from the ages of 2 to 11

Single-form entry (one class per year group)

More than 200 pupils and approximately 40 staff members

Strong partnerships with the local community, Church, and families

Free school meal eligibility rate of 3.3%

St James' Church School has a reputation for providing a safe and caring environment, with an emphasis on excellence in academic standards and spiritual formation based on Christian principles. The school has received the Righteous Among the Nations Award, a national honor presented by the Holocaust Education Trust to schools that demonstrate exceptional achievement in Holocaust education.

St James' Church School aims to develop pupils' character and knowledge, cultivating a love for God and one another and inspiring each pupil to fulfill their fullest potential. It is an inclusive school that provides quality education and pastoral support, tailored to the needs of its diverse student body. The school also stresses the importance of local community involvement, actively fostering collaboration with the Teddington area.
